subject: Ethics
title: Factory Farming Ethics
description: A micro-lesson that makes Factory Farming Ethics usable.

hook.text: A chicken raised for meat today lives about 42 days in a space smaller than a sheet of paper.

buildup.text: Factory farms produce 99% of U.S. meat. They prioritize efficiency over animal welfare.

discovery.text: Ethicists argue the scale of sufferingâ€”over 70 billion land animals killed yearlyâ€”makes it a moral crisis.

twist.text: Most people oppose animal cruelty but eat factory-farmed meat daily. Philosophers call this moral dissonance.

climax.text: The debate isn't just about animals. Factory farming drives deforestation, pollution, and antibiotic resistance.

punchline.text: We oppose cruelty in principle but fund it at every meal.

quiz.question: What ethical contradiction does factory farming highlight?
options: People support animal welfare but consume products from systems that cause mass animal suffering
Factory farms are more humane than traditional farms
Vegetarianism is the only morally acceptable diet
